intro: Spergularia pazensis, commonly known as the Pazén's sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with succulent stems and leaves adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Spergularia pazensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
